content:
TITLE: Finding Top 10 Models by Run Count in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This code example demonstrates how to use the package along with lodash-es to find and sort the top 10 models by their run count in descending order.
SOURCE: https://github.com/replicate/all-the-public-replicate-models/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_3

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import models from 'all-the-public-replicate-models'
import {chain} from 'lodash-es'

const mostRun = chain(models).orderBy('run_count', 'desc').take(10).value()
console.log({mostRun})
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing Full Model Metadata in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This code demonstrates how to import and use the full model metadata from the all-the-public-replicate-models package. It provides access to all metadata, which is approximately 17MB in size.
SOURCE: https://github.com/replicate/all-the-public-replicate-models/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import models from 'all-the-public-replicate-models'

console.log(models)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Accessing Historical Run Count Statistics in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet illustrates how to import and use the historical daily run count statistics for models. It shows how to access the last 5 days of statistics for a specific model.
SOURCE: https://github.com/replicate/all-the-public-replicate-models/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_4

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import stats from 'all-the-public-replicate-models/stats'

console.log(stats["black-forest-labs/flux-schnell"].slice(-5))

/*
[
  { date: '2025-01-03', totalRuns: 176951005, dailyRuns: 1071498 },
  { date: '2025-01-04', totalRuns: 178025758, dailyRuns: 1074753 },
  { date: '2025-01-05', totalRuns: 179119496, dailyRuns: 1093738 },
  { date: '2025-01-06', totalRuns: 180272877, dailyRuns: 1153381 },
  { date: '2025-01-07', totalRuns: 181445133, dailyRuns: 1172256 }
]
*/
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Filtering Whisper Models and Sorting by Run Count Using CLI and jq
DESCRIPTION: This command shows how to use the package's CLI output with jq to filter for Whisper models, sort them by run count, and display the results in a custom format.
SOURCE: https://github.com/replicate/all-the-public-replicate-models/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_6

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npx all-the-public-replicate-models | jq -r 'map(select(.name | contains("whisper"))) | sort_by(.run_count) | reverse | .[] | "\(.url) \(.run_count)"'
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Markdown Model Statistics Table
DESCRIPTION: Tabular representation of model statistics showing model names, descriptions, daily runs, total runs, and usage percentages. Table is formatted in markdown with alignment and column headers.
SOURCE: https://github.com/replicate/all-the-public-replicate-models/blob/main/stats.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Model | Description | Runs Today | Runs Total | % of Total |
|-------|-------------|------------|------------|------------|
| [meta/meta-llama-guard-2-8b](https://replicate.com/meta/meta-llama-guard-2-8b) | Meta Llama Guard 2 is an 8B parameter Llama 3-based LLM safeguard model | 23 | 23 | 100.00% |
| [lucataco/deepseek-67b-base](https://replicate.com/lucataco/deepseek-67b-base) | DeepSeek LLM, an advanced language model comprising 67 billion parameters. Trained from scratch on a vast dataset of 2 trillion tokens in both English and Chinese | 4 | 7 | 57.14% |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Displaying Active Replicate Models in Markdown Table
DESCRIPTION: This markdown snippet creates a table showing active Replicate models, their descriptions, and usage statistics. It includes columns for the model name (with a link), description, and the number of runs in the last day.
SOURCE: https://github.com/replicate/all-the-public-replicate-models/blob/main/stats.md#2025-04-22_snippet_1

LANGUAGE: markdown
CODE:
```
| Model | Description | Runs in the last day |
|-------|-------------|---------------------|
| [bytedance/sdxl-lightning-4step](https://replicate.com/bytedance/sdxl-lightning-4step) | SDXL-Lightning by ByteDance: a fast text-to-image model that makes high-quality images in 4 steps | 323955 |
| [meta/meta-llama-3-70b-instruct](https://replicate.com/meta/meta-llama-3-70b-instruct) | A 70 billion parameter language model from Meta, fine tuned for chat completions | 58277 |
| [salesforce/blip](https://replicate.com/salesforce/blip) | Bootstrapping Language-Image Pre-training | 37319 |
| [nightmareai/real-esrgan](https://replicate.com/nightmareai/real-esrgan) | Real-ESRGAN with optional face correction and adjustable upscale | 37015 |
| [tencentarc/gfpgan](https://replicate.com/tencentarc/gfpgan) | Practical face restoration algorithm for *old photos* or *AI-generated faces* | 21712 |
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Importing Lite Model Metadata in JavaScript
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to import and use the lite version of the model metadata, which only includes basic information and is about 375KB in size.
SOURCE: https://github.com/replicate/all-the-public-replicate-models/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_2

LANGUAGE: javascript
CODE:
```
import models from 'all-the-public-replicate-models/lite'

console.log(models)
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Saving Model Data to a File Using CLI
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to use the package's CLI to output all model data and save it to a JSON file for further processing or analysis.
SOURCE: https://github.com/replicate/all-the-public-replicate-models/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_7

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npx all-the-public-replicate-models > models.json
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Using CLI to Output Model Metadata
DESCRIPTION: This command demonstrates how to use the package's CLI to output all model metadata as a JSON object to the standard output.
SOURCE: https://github.com/replicate/all-the-public-replicate-models/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_5

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
$ npx all-the-public-replicate-models
```

----------------------------------------

TITLE: Installing all-the-public-replicate-models Package with NPM
DESCRIPTION: This snippet shows how to install the all-the-public-replicate-models package using npm. It's a prerequisite for using the package in your project.
SOURCE: https://github.com/replicate/all-the-public-replicate-models/blob/main/README.md#2025-04-22_snippet_0

LANGUAGE: sh
CODE:
```
npm install all-the-public-replicate-models
```
